summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) personnel discussing coordination with the Department of Justice's Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) and the FBI regarding a planned meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on updating victim contact lists for the meeting, which is a requirement of the DOJ's settlement in the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) litigation, and on logistical arrangements to avoid substantive discussions during the meeting.

persons.name: Wendy Olsen
persons.context: Mentioned as a key contact person for FBI victim services, to be contacted by ODAG for updated victim information.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: A team member in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who was previously briefed about the victim meeting plans.

persons.name: Bekah
persons.context: An SDNY team member who has been in touch with ODAG to coordinate the victim meeting and share lessons from previous victim meetings.

persons.name: Stacie
persons.context: The coordinator from the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) who is organizing the victim meeting and has been in contact with SDNY.

persons.name: John
persons.context: An official (likely FBI or SDNY) whom the email author offers to raise logistical matters with directly.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: An official (likely FBI or SDNY) whom the email author offers to raise logistical matters with directly.

connections.description: Stacie from ODAG and Bekah from SDNY have been in touch to coordinate the logistics and planning of the victim meeting required by the CVRA settlement.
The SDNY team is coordinating with FBI victim services, particularly Wendy Olsen, to obtain and verify the most updated list of victim contact information.
ODAG is working with the SDNY to organize a victim meeting, relying on SDNY for victim lists and logistical advice based on past experience.

events.title: Planned DOJ victim meeting in DC
events.description: The Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) is planning a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein in Washington, D.C., likely within 3-4 weeks. The meeting is a requirement of the Department's settlement in the CVRA litigation and aims to explain and review the findings of OPR's investigation.

events.title: Nolle proceeding and victim list creation
events.description: In August 2019, following a nolle proceeding (likely related to Epstein's death or case closure), the SDNY generated and sent a list of identified victims to ODAG. This list is now being reviewed and updated for the planned 2020 meeting.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Department of Justice is organizing a victim meeting as part of its settlement in the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA) litigation related to Jeffrey Epstein.

There is an effort to compile a comprehensive and updated list of victims, including those identified since August 2019, victims from New York, adult victims, and victims of crimes other than or in addition to sex trafficking.
The planning emphasizes avoiding substantive discussions of victims' experiences during the main meeting, instead offering private sessions with an FBI agent.
Inter-agency coordination is evident between the SDNY, ODAG, and the FBI's victim services to manage victim outreach and meeting logistics.
The email chain reveals an ongoing administrative and legal process to address victim rights and communication years after Epstein's death.
